nominalpy.data package

Submodules

nominalpy.data.frame module

class nominalpy.data.frame.SimulationData(data: dict)

Bases: object

The DataFrame class is able to store a series of parameters and data associated with a particular simulation instance. This class is a pure data class and is not able to invoke any methods. It is able to store the data in a structured format and is able to be exported to a JSON format.

data: list = []

Defines the data that is associated with the SimulationData.

export() → dict

Exports the SimulationData to a dictionary format that is able to be exported to the API. This will return the SimulationData in the same format that is fetched from the API.

Returns:

The SimulationData in a dictionary format

Return type:

dict

fields: list = []

Defines the fields that are associated with the SimulationData.

get_times() → ndarray

Returns the time values that are associated with the SimulationData. This is a helper function that is able to fetch the time values from the SimulationData, where each value is in seconds.

Returns:

The time values that are associated with the SimulationData in seconds

Return type:

np.ndarray

get_values(parameter: str) → ndarray

Returns the values that are associated with a particular parameter in the SimulationData. This is a helper function that is able to fetch the values associated with a particular parameter in the SimulationData.

Parameters:

parameter (str) – The parameter to fetch the values for

Returns:

The values that are associated with the parameter

Return type:

np.ndarray

id: str = ''

Defines the unique GUID identifier of the object. This needs to be in the correct GUID format.

classmethod load(path: str) → SimulationData

Loads a SimulationData from a file path and returns the SimulationData object. This is a class method and does not require an instance to be created.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to the file that contains the SimulationData

Returns:

The SimulationData object that is loaded from the file

Return type:

SimulationData

plot(title='Simulation Data', params=None) → None

Creates a quick plot of the SimulationData data. This will plot the data in a simple line plot format and will display the data in a single plot or multiple plots depending on the parameters provided. The following formats for the parameters will work:

params = “MyParam” -> will plot ‘MyParam’ against Time in a single plot params = [“MyParam1”, “MyParam2”] -> will plot ‘MyParam1’ and ‘MyParam2’ against Time in a single plot params = [[“MyParam1”], [“MyParam2”]] -> will plot ‘MyParam1’ and ‘MyParam2’ against Time in separate plots

Parameters:

  • title (str) – The title of the plot

  • params (str or list) – The parameters to plot

save(path: str) → None

Saves the SimulationData to a file path in a JSON format. This will save the SimulationData in a JSON format that is able to be loaded back into the SimulationData class.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to save the SimulationData to

to_dataframe() → DataFrame

Converts the SimulationData to a pandas DataFrame. This will convert the SimulationData to a pandas DataFrame and will return the DataFrame object.

Returns:

The SimulationData in a pandas DataFrame format

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

type: str = ''

Defines the object type that was used for this SimulationData.
